data.text:
This is a suggested itinerary for a private group with a minimum of 12 people traveling together. Some of these experiences are seasonal and may not be available. In those instances, we will source alternatives for your group.

Explore the breathtaking scenery of Norwayâs fjords on this 7-Night Private Small Group Norwegian Fjords tour. With overnight stays in Oslo, FlÃ¥m, Bergen, and Hardangerfjord - each featuring a boutique accommodation - this vacation is the perfect way to explore Norway.

Your tour begins in the countryâs beloved capital - Oslo. Here, you will meet your guide and be treated to a tour of the cityâs famous landmarks and neighborhoods. After two nights in Oslo, your journey continues to Myrdal, where you will board the historical mountain train of FlÃ¥msbana - considered to be one of the most breathtaking train routes in the world.

The train will take you to the village of FlÃ¥m, which sits on the shore of NÃ¦rÃ¸yfjord, for your overnight stay complete with stunning views. Before you continue on to Bergen, you will be treated to a mini cruise through Sognefjord - Norwayâs longest and steepest fjord. Once in Bergen, your guide will take you on a city tour, hitting famous landmarks such as Bryggen Pier and the Troldhaugen Museum. After a full day of leisure in the city of Bergen, your tour wraps up with a scenic road trip along the Hardangerfjord and a indulgent seafood dinner experience.

With the perfect balance of untouched landscapes and major Norwegian cities, this tour is sure to delight every type of traveler.

Day 1

Accommodation

Ideally Located Hotel - Oslo, Eastern Norway

Room Type: Double / Twin

Check in policies:

Check-in time is after 3.00pm on your day of arrival. Check-out time is before 12.00pm.

Daily Itinerary

Arrive in Oslo

Arrive at the hotel and take some time to settle in. In the evening you'll meet your tour guide for a briefing before enjoying an included dinner at the hotel for your group.

Arrive at

Arrive at Oslo Airport, Gardermoen, Eastern Norway

Arrive today at Oslo Airport, Gardermoen.

Overnight Location

Oslo, Eastern Norway

On The Map: Oslo, the capital of Norway, is situated on the countryâs southern coast at the head of the Oslofjord. The city is reached via route E6 from Hamar (to the North) and via route E18 from Drammen (to the southwest). As one of Europeâs fastest-growing cities, Oslo is buzzing with energy. From new neighborhoods and cutting-edge food, to fashion and art scenes, Norwayâs capital has something for everyone. Captivating landmarks like the Opera House, the Astrup Fearnley Museum and Barcode are changing the face of the city. Although an ever-changing city, Oslo continues to maintain its refreshing closeness to nature, something that very few capitals can do. The city was even named European Green Capital 2019 for its dedication to conserving natural areas and reducing pollution. The restaurant scene is diverse, and many of the new, innovative kitchens offer a fresh approach to Norwayâs traditional dishes. With an efficient public transport system, compact city center, and safe environment, Oslo is easy to navigate without a car. Take off on foot or by bike to explore this magnificent Norwegian city.

Day 2

Accommodation

Ideally Located Hotel - Oslo, Eastern Norway

Room Type: Double / Twin

Check in policies:

Check-in time is after 3.00pm on your day of arrival. Check-out time is before 12.00pm.

Daily Itinerary

Bustling Oslo - Cultural Capital of Norway

Today we explore Oslo in depth as we visit its landmarks and wander around its many districts. Main sights that we will see include the Royal Palace, the medieval fortress of Akershus, the modern opera house, the city hall and the wharf of Aker Brygge Pier. Next, we explore Osloâs cultural centre â BygdÃ¸y Island â home to three impressive museums: Viking Museum, Kon Tiki and Fram Museum. For a tranquil respite from the bustling city streets, we stroll through Frogner Park, home to the Vigeland Sculpture Park, one of Osloâs most popular tourist attractions. In the afternoon consider spending some free time in the lovely shopping street of Karl Johan or perhaps enjoy the seafront at the Tjuvholmen island or Aker Brygge Pier, the Scandinavian answer to St. Tropez!

Dinner included at your hotel.

Day 3

Accommodation

Exquisite Fjord View Hotel - Flam, Western Norway

Room Type: Double / Twin

Check in policies:

Check-in time is after 4.00pm on your day of arrival. Check-out time is before 11.00am

Daily Itinerary

Sognefjord Cruise & FlÃ¥m Railway

We transfer to the Railway Station to catch the NSB train to Myrdal. Our journey takes us into the wild and scenic Norwegian fjord landscape, past the idyllic resort of Geilo and up to the mountain station in Myrdal. In Myrdal, we board the historical mountain train of FlÃ¥msbana. This train ride is considered to be one of the most breathtaking in the world thanks to its scenic stops which include sparkling waterfalls and idyllic valleys. We then journey to FlÃ¥m village, located on the shore of the deep NÃ¦rÃ¸yfjord where you'll enjoy a 2-hour mini cruise through the magical Sognefjord, Norwayâs longest and steepest fjord with absolutely breathtaking scenery and an absolute highlight of our tour.

Dinner included at your hotel.

Overnight Location

Flam, Western Norway

On the map: The charming town of FlÃ¥m is situated at the innermost point of Aurlandsfjord, a branch of the Sognefjord - the world's deepest and second-longest fjord.

Surrounded by sheer mountainsides, towering waterfalls, and narrow valleys, this area is paradise for anyone seeking the unique and spectacular nature that Norway has to offer.F lÃ¥m offers some of the most well-known attractions in Norway. FlÃ¥msbana - the FlÃ¥m Railway - is widely recognized as one of the steepest and most lovely railways in the world. The dramatic Stegastein viewing platform juts out high above the Aurlandsfjord. South of FlÃ¥m Harbor, the 17th-century wooden FlÃ¥m Church lies in the valley. FlÃ¥m is also home of the spectacular NÃ¦rÃ¸yfjord, listed as a UNESCO World Heritage Site.

As FlÃ¥m is one of four harbours that welcome cruise ships to Aurland Harbour Authority, large cruise ships gliding into Sognefjord to FlÃ¥m harbour are a daily sight in spring and summer.

Day 4

Accommodation

Stylish Waterside Hotel - Bergen, Western Norway

Room Type: Double / Twin

Check in policies:

Check-in time is after 3.00pm on your day of arrival. Check-out time is before 12.00pm noon.

Daily Itinerary

Bergen's Fish Market & Museums

Today you'll go for a 4 hour panoramic tour of Bergen with a local guide. We visit the Bryggen Pier to enjoy a fish tasting at the Fish Me Fishmarket and visit the Troldhaugen Museum, home of famous composer Edvard Grieg. There will also be time for an exterior visit of the mystical Fantoft Stave Church â a short drive outside the city.

Dinner included at your hotel

Overnight Location

Bergen, Western Norway

On The Map: Bergen is a city on Norwayâs southwestern coast. It's surrounded by mountains and fjords, including Sognefjord, the countryâs longest and deepest.

Bergen is the Gateway to the Fjords of Norway. As a UNESCO World Heritage City and a European City of Culture, the Bergen region has the ideal combination of nature, culture and exciting urban life all year around. When in Bergen, you are close many spectacular fjord experiences - whether you want to go on a fjord cruise or dive into the experience with glacier hiking in the majestic mountain landscape, skiing in some of Norwayâs best terrains, biking along the beautiful fjord arms or exploring the wet element with white water rafting along the beautiful coastline.

Bergen is also a proud European City of Culture and has held a strong cultural identity ever since the merchants brought life to the harbor around Bryggen in the mid-1300s. Today Bergen is a cultural melting pot, with a wide range of concerts, international festivals, and museums of all kinds.

Day 5

Accommodation

Stylish Waterside Hotel - Bergen, Western Norway

Room Type: Double / Twin

Check in policies:

Check-in time is after 3.00pm on your day of arrival. Check-out time is before 12.00pm noon.

Daily Itinerary

Bergen & Funicular Train FlÃ¸ibanen

There is free time today to relax or to explore this picturesque city independently. Alternatively, we can arrange a 1-hour helicopter ride over the Hardangerfjord. In the early evening, we take the funicular FlÃ¸ibanen through the mountain up to Bergenâs highest point for stunning views of the city and its surrounding fjords.

Dinner included at your hotel

Room Type: Double / Twin

Check in policies:

Check-in time is after 3.00pm on your day of arrival. Check-out time is before 12.00pm noon

Daily Itinerary

Hardangerfjord

Our road trip continues southwards today, passing the tremendous waterfalls of Steindalsvossen and onto the scenic road along the Hardangerfjord. We cross the fjord by car ferry at Kvanndal to Utne, where we visit Hardanger Folk Museum to hear about the history of the area and its local society. We continue by ferry to Kinsarvik where we drive the remaining few minutes to our hotel for the night, located directly in front of the Hardangerfjord. We will spend the rest of the afternoon in this spectacular setting.

Dinner included at your hotel.

Overnight Location

Lofthus, Western Norway

On the map: Lofthus is a village in Ullensvang municipality which is located in the Hardanger region of Hordaland county, Norway. The village lies along the eastern shore of the SÃ¸rfjorden, along the Norwegian National Road 13. Lofthus is often dubbed 'the orchard of Hardanger' with fantastic views to the Folgefonna glacier.

Visiting Lofthus gives you a good starting point for many exciting experiences. The surrounding area is often known as the orchard of Hardanger, a name this beautiful district bears proudly.

The scenery in Hardanger is at its most beautiful in Lofthus, with fantastic views of the Folgefonna glacier. It is easy to understand why Lofthus was one of Edvard Grieg's favourite haunts.

Spring reveals a pink and white symphony of apple blossoms contrasting sharply with green hills and snow-capped mountains, with the fjord as a backdrop. Lofthus is situated on the eastern shore of SÃ¸rfjorden, an arm of the Hardangerfjord.

Room Type: Double / Twin

Check in policies:

Daily Itinerary

Return to Oslo

Today you'll journey from Hardangerfjord back to Oslo stopping at the elaborate Heddal Stave Church near Notoddenm Telemark. The largest stave chuch in Norway, this impressive 13th-century structure has the appearance of a wooden cathedral with 3 distinctive towers. For our last evening we'll indulge in shellfish and king crab platters at Tjuvholmen Sjomagasinet, a vast fine dining seafood experience with multiple dining rooms, a crab and lobster tank, sprawling terrace, wine bar, and wet fish shop.
